title: iOS Core Concepts Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of iOS fundamentals

questions.question: What is the correct order of app lifecycle states?
options: Not Running → Inactive → Active → Background → Suspended
questions.explanation: The lifecycle flows: Not Running → Inactive (transitional) → Active → Background → Suspended. Inactive is brief transition state.

questions.question: Which method is called EVERY time a view controller's view appears?
questions.explanation: viewWillAppear is called every time view is about to appear. viewDidLoad is called once when view loads into memory.

questions.question: What happens when ARC reference count reaches zero?
options: Object is marked for garbage collection
questions.explanation: ARC is deterministic. When strong reference count hits 0, deinit is called and object is immediately deallocated. No garbage collector.

questions.question: Which causes a retain cycle?
options: Class storing closure that captures self strongly
Using guard let to unwrap optional
questions.explanation: Retain cycle: Class holds closure → closure captures self strongly → neither can be deallocated. Fix with [weak self].

questions.question: What's the difference between frame and bounds?
options: frame uses auto layout, bounds doesn't
frame is in superview coordinates, bounds is in own coordinates
bounds includes safe area, frame doesn't
questions.explanation: frame = position/size in superview's coordinate system. bounds = position/size in own coordinate system (origin usually 0,0).

questions.question: Why does UITableView reuse cells?
options: Memory efficiency - only visible cells exist
questions.explanation: Cell reuse is a performance optimization. Only visible cells + small buffer exist in memory, allowing infinite scrolling with fixed memory.

questions.question: Where should you store user passwords in iOS?
questions.explanation: Keychain is the only secure storage for sensitive data. It's encrypted, persists across reinstalls, and designed for credentials.

questions.question: What does the responder chain handle?
questions.explanation: Responder chain handles touch events, motion events, and actions. Events travel up from first responder through views, VC, window, to app.

questions.question: Which is TRUE about NotificationCenter vs Delegation?
options: They can't be used in the same app
questions.explanation: Delegation is 1-to-1 with explicit contract. NotificationCenter broadcasts to multiple observers, loosely coupled.

questions.question: What is App Transport Security (ATS)?
options: Security feature requiring HTTPS for network
questions.explanation: ATS enforces HTTPS, TLS 1.2+, and forward secrecy for network connections. Exceptions can be added but may cause App Store rejection.
